Top-3 Scripts:
au_968464: sudo ip route add 10.0.0.0/8 dev ppp0 metric 25

#!/bin/sh

if [ "$IFACE" = "ppp0" ]; then
     ifmetric enp4s0 1
     ip route add 10.0.0.0/8 dev ppp0 metric 25
fi

au_600147: sudo openvpn --config "TunnelBear Germany.ovpn"

wget https://s3.amazonaws.com/tunnelbear/linux/openvpn.zip

unzip openvpn.zip

cd openvpn

sudo openvpn --config "TunnelBear Germany.ovpn"

wget https://s3.amazonaws.com/tunnelbear/linux/openvpn.zip; unzip openvpn.zip

mv openvpn tunnelbear.d; cd tunnelbear.d

for f in *.ovpn; do mv "$f" `echo $f | sed 's/ //g;s/TunnelBear//g'`; done

cd ..; chmod 600 tunnelbear.d/*; sudo chown root:root tunnelbear.d/*

Explanations about Options.-p:
Load in sysctl settings from the file specified or /etc/sysctl.conf if none given.
 Specifying - as filename means reading data from standard input. Using this option
 will mean arguments to sysctl are files, which are read in the order they are
 specified. The file argument may be specified as regular expression.
Explanations about Options.-w: Use this option when all arguments prescribe a key to be set.

Explanations about Options.--home:
DIR
 Use DIR as the user's home directory, rather than the default specified by the
 configuration file. If the directory does not exist, it is created and skeleton
 files are copied.
Explanations about Options.--quiet: Suppress informational messages, only show warnings and errors.
Explanations about Options.--system: Create a system user or group.
